description.narrative: Provide technical assistance to improve national program of AIDS, TB, and Malaria implementation performance benefitting both women and men

activity-description.narrative: The main activity held in Jakarta, directly with CCM Secretariat and Ministry of Health

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Implementation for technical suport for grant management and support for the CCM Indonesia full compliance for implementation development or improvement The Global Fund project requirement

comment.narrative: technical assistance and support for CCM Secretariat Indonesia to support AIDS, TB, and Malaria Programme.

- ensure the Global Fund implementation in which PRs have to fullfil the Global Fund requirement such as the PRs Project Implementation Manual (PIM) development or improvement, monev etc. - ensure providing technical assistance for grant management and support oversight functions of the CCM Indonesia through Technical Working Group for AIDS, TB, and Malaria

1. Preparation of Capacity Assessment After being announced as a PR candidate by the CCM, the new TB PR Community – Consortium of Penabulu STPI, is preparing to enter the GFATM capacity assessment which was conducted by the Local Fund Agency of the GFATM. Before signing a grant agreement with a Principal Recipient, the Global Fund ensures that the proposed implementation arrangements are sound. To do so, the Global Fund assesses whether systems and capacities of grant implementers are adequate for effective management of the grant funds. This is required to ensure the Global Fund partnership with the country can deliver maximum impact against the three diseases. The assessment is done using a tool called the Capacity Assessment tool. The UNDP technical advisor provides support by introducing the capacity assessment tools that will be used by the LFA, and by assisting the new PR to prepare – which includes their knowledge and understanding of country proposals that have been approved by the GFATM’s TRP.
2. Support during the CAT The UNDP technical advisor provides support to the new PR during an assessment to ensure that the new PR could properly present that the proposed implementation arrangements, systems and capacities of key grant implementers are adequate for effective financial and programmatic management of the grant funds. The UNDP technical advisor also assists and supports a new PR team to adequately respond to LFA questions and clarification in the following functional areas: · monitoring and evaluation · procurement and supply management · financial management and systems · governance and program management (including Sub-recipient management)
3. Support during the Grant Making Process During the grant-making process, the Country Coordinating Mechanism (CCM) and the country team of the Global Fund work with the PR of the documents required for a preparation of the Grant Confirmation. The UNDP technical advisor facilitates and supports the new PR to understand the process and to prepare the entire documents specific for a new PR, as a part of the Funding request documents. They are Performance Framework (PF), Work plan and detail budget, PSCM and M&E
4. Develop M&E plan The UNDP technical advisor assists and technically supports the PR Consortium of PB-STPI to develop this plan, to ensure that the new PR have a monitoring and evaluation plan based on the agreed PF document. The monitoring and evaluation plan contain detailed information on: · Indicators · Data management · Data quality assurance · Evaluations · Monitoring and evaluation coordination · Capacity building for monitoring and evaluation · Budget and workplan for monitoring and evaluation.
The monitoring and evaluation plan should also include activities and budget to strengthen the national M&E system. The M&E plan must be well developed and submitted prior to the grant signing, and must also be in line with the National M&E plan developed by the National program of the Ministry of Health.
5. Develop Project Implementation Manual This document is required and is one of the important documents that must be developed by every PR as a guideline for the implementation/operational activities in accordance with the work plan and budget to achieve the target according to the indicators in the PF document that have been determined and agreed between PR and CT.
Each Project Implementation Manual should at least describe the organization of the PR, SR, and SSR grant management. This organization was developed to accommodate the Implementation Arrangements Mapping which had also been mutually agreed upon. The next chapter that must be written is the implementation of activities to achieve the targets according to the indicators in the PF, followed by a monitoring and evaluation system for the implementation of this program. Financial management & procurement and supply management should also be written very clearly in this guide.
6. Technical Assistance for new PRs on Institutional Strengthening in Managing Grant GFATM. This includes technical input for workshop PIM for the PR team, Monthly meeting PR and the GFATM Country Team, Quarterly Review Meeting PRs, TWG and The GF Country team, COVID-19 Response Mechanism (C19RM) proposal development, and add Debt-to-Health Swap financed interventions to TB grants.
7. Assessment Report of Aids, Tb, Malaria Supply Chain Management
8. Assessment Report of Gender Mainstreaming on Policy and Program related to HIV and AIDS Prevention and Program

- Strengthen the CCM Indonesia in managing multi-donor funds and facilitating CCM Indonesia’s activities - Management and Technical Assistance for a new PRs/National Sub-Recipients (SRs) - Strengthening implementation of community, human rights, gender - Technical Assistance on local government’s development planning implementation and local government budgeting on prevention and care of AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria program

Q1 Progress: - 7 out of 11 CCM has been hired to strengthen function of CCM and TWG ATM through monitoring monthly call meeting - Recruited an advisor to oversee implementation of activities and development of report of 2 new PR (Adinkes and Consortium STPI Penabulu) - Recruited a Human Right Technical Officer for a strategized implementation of cross-cutting activities - Recruited technical officer for RSSH
